articles.title: DPRK Foreign Ministry on launch of U.S. military operation
articles.content:
DPRK Foreign Ministry on launch of U.S. military operation 
    Pyongyang. October 9 (KCNA)-A spokesman for the Foreign Ministry of the DPRK today answered the following question put by KCNA as regards the U.S. launch of its military operation in retaliation against the large-scale terrorist attacks.
 The U.S. proclaimed what it calls "military retaliation" after the large-scale terrorist attacks on the U.S. and has made its preparations in every way.
 On October 8 it launched a military operation against Afghanistan.
 As a consequence, the world faces another war. As already clarified, it is the principled stand of the DPRK to oppose all forms of terrorism and any support to it and so the DPRK has been consistently opposed to terrorism.
 The DPRK's opposition to terrorism is aimed to promote global peace and stability and defend the sovereignty of the country and nation and protect the safety of the people and their properties.
 The method of combating terrorism should be in full accord with such purpose in any case. The use of armed forces or a war to kill innocent people and aggravate regional situation and disturb regional stability contrary to the purpose can not be justified under any circumstances. We hold that the action of the U.S. should not be a source of vicious circle of terrorism and retaliation that may plunge the world into the holocaust of war.
 The DPRK has so far done what it is obliged to do to combat terrorism.
 The U.S., however, has pursued a hostile policy toward the DPRK, still keeping it on the list of "sponsors of terrorism" under an unreasonable pretext.
 Under this situation the DPRK is following the situation with vigilance.
 The DPRK is proud that it has increased its national defence capabilities of its own choice in every way no matter what others may say.
 The DPRK will closely watch the developments in full readiness to cope with any case.

Greetings to Ugandan President
articles.content:
Greetings to Ugandan President 
    Pyongyang, October 8 (KCNA) -- President Kim Yong Nam of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly on October 4 sent a message of greetings to Ugandan President Yoweri Kaguta Museveni on the occasion of the 39th anniversary of the Independence of Uganda.
 The message extended congratulations to the president, government and people of Uganda on the independence day, and wished the president and people of Uganda greater success in their efforts for the nation's peace and stability and the growth of the national economy.    
 It expressed conviction that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries will grow stronger.
